Class TextBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • TextBox
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class TextBox
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    TextBox displays the message: "real time wireless data from the gibbot" with an animated wireless signal.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      TextBox(int widthOfContainer, int heightOfContainer)

      • ANDALE_BIG

        private final java.awt.Font ANDALE_BIG
        Font used to write. Set to bold, size 36.

        Specified by LayoutContainerPanel parent. Used to set preferred dimensons in constructor

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextBox

        public TextBox(int widthOfContainer,
               int heightOfContainer)
        Constructor sets preferred size to tell layout manager of LayoutContainerPanel how to draw this panel; Initializes some graphics elements including wireless signal.
        Parameters:
        widthOfContainer - used to set width
        heightOfContainer - used to set height

    • Method Detail

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Override of JComponent.paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics). super.paintComponent() call fills background color. This is what is executed whenever repaint() is called in the program. Calls drawTextBubble(int, int, int, int, java.awt.Graphics) to draw everything. If images need to be relocated/resized, change parameters of this call.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics context for drawing. Kind of a black box; gets handled in the background somehow

      • drawTextBubble

        public void drawTextBubble(int x,
                           int y,
                           int width,
                           int height,
                           java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws all graphics for the TextBox panel.
        Parameters:
        x - X-coor of upper left corner
        y - Y-coor of upper left corner
        width - Width of rectangle available to draw text in
        height - Height of rectangle available to draw text in
        g - Graphics context to draw with.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt)
        Specifies how to respond to timer events from GUITimer. This panel uses events as a signal to update wireless at frequency determined by UPDATE_COUNT.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        evt - The timer event (not important to code but required by java.awt.event#ActionListener interface)
